text: by February 26, 2025Source: YouTube "They are much stronger and faster..." Well Go USA has revealed an official trailer for a Thai horror thriller movie called Operation Undead, made by filmmaker Kongkiat Komesiri. This first premiered at the 2024 New York Asian Film Festival, and opened in Thai theaters last August, with a US release on VOD finally set for this March. This looks totally disgusting! Inexperienced Thai soldiers battle a growing undead menace in this gruesome survival horror. A Japanese military experiment turning men into monsters (basically they're fast zombies) escapes containment, it’s up to these troops to save their nation from annihilation. Set in 1941 in Thailand. Mok and his ragtag unit of young soldiers are thrown against the invading Japanese forces. The invaders bring with them a terrifying biological weapon, unaware that it has plans of its own... Will they be able to stop these undead from taking over? This stars Nonkul (aka actor Chanon Santinatornkul), Awat Ratanapintha, Supitcha Sangkhachinda, Ararat Nimtchai, and Seigi Ohzeki. This one is made for all the crazy gross disgusting horror movie fanatics out there! So much gooey, slimy nastiness in this trailer. Here's the official US trailer (+ poster) for Kongkiat Komesiri's horror Operation Undead, on YouTube: World War II – 1941. Chumphon Province, Thailand. Mek (Chanon Santinatornkul), a new sergeant, and Mok (Awat Ratanapintha), his younger brother in the Youth Soldier unit, face a mysterious threat when "something" belonging to the Japanese goes missing during their landing. This leads Mok and his fellow youth soldiers to encounter horrors far worse than war. Even after Thailand & Japan declare a ceasefire, Mek receives a special covert mission to clean up the area alongside a Japanese combat unit, unaware that this might include his own brother. Operation Undead, also called Operacion Zombie: Resurreccion in Spanish, is written and directed by Thai filmmaker Kongkiat Komesiri (aka Kome Kongkiat Komesiri), of the films Sema: The Warrior of Ayodhaya, Art of the Devil 2 & 3, Muay Thai Fighter, Slice, The 4 Movie, The Gangster, Take Me Home, Khun Phan 1 & 2 & 3, Pay It Forward, and Bangkok Breaking: Heaven and Hell previously. Executive produced by Francis Smith. This initially premiered at the 2024 New York Asian Film Festival last year, and opened in Thailand last August. Well Go USA will release Komesiri's Operation Undead horror film direct-to-VOD in the US starting March 25th, 2025 coming soon. Anyone into this? This first premiered at the 2024 New York Asian Film Festival, and opened in Thai theaters last August, with a US release on VOD finally set for this March. This looks totally disgusting! Inexperienced Thai soldiers battle a growing undead menace in this gruesome survival horror. A Japanese military experiment turning men into monsters (basically they're fast zombies) escapes containment, it’s up to these troops to save their nation from annihilation. Set in 1941 in Thailand. Mok and his ragtag unit of young soldiers are thrown against the invading Japanese forces. The invaders bring with them a terrifying biological weapon, unaware that it has plans of its own... Will they be able to stop these undead from taking over? This stars Nonkul (aka actor Chanon Santinatornkul), Awat Ratanapintha, Supitcha Sangkhachinda, Ararat Nimtchai, and Seigi Ohzeki. This one is made for all the crazy gross disgusting horror movie fanatics out there! So much gooey, slimy nastiness in this trailer.

Here's the official US trailer (+ poster) for Kongkiat Komesiri's horror Operation Undead, on YouTube:

World War II – 1941. Chumphon Province, Thailand. Mek (Chanon Santinatornkul), a new sergeant, and Mok (Awat Ratanapintha), his younger brother in the Youth Soldier unit, face a mysterious threat when "something" belonging to the Japanese goes missing during their landing. This leads Mok and his fellow youth soldiers to encounter horrors far worse than war. Even after Thailand & Japan declare a ceasefire, Mek receives a special covert mission to clean up the area alongside a Japanese combat unit, unaware that this might include his own brother. Operation Undead, also called Operacion Zombie: Resurreccion in Spanish, is written and directed by Thai filmmaker Kongkiat Komesiri (aka Kome Kongkiat Komesiri), of the films Sema: The Warrior of Ayodhaya, Art of the Devil 2 & 3, Muay Thai Fighter, Slice, The 4 Movie, The Gangster, Take Me Home, Khun Phan 1 & 2 & 3, Pay It Forward, and Bangkok Breaking: Heaven and Hell previously. Executive produced by Francis Smith. This initially premiered at the 2024 New York Asian Film Festival last year, and opened in Thailand last August. Well Go USA will release Komesiri's Operation Undead horror film direct-to-VOD in the US starting March 25th, 2025 coming soon. Anyone into this?
